mods.abstract: LeGaux discusses wetlands education and restoration, the plight of Louisiana land loss, erosion, subsidence, sea level rise, hurricanes, and levees.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.2357; A digital version of the index (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Nicholas Rouchon.

Amelia "Amy" LeGaux was born in Columbus, Ohio, and grew up in San Diego, California. She moved to New Orleans to work at the Audubon Zoo and eventually transferred to the Nature Center in New Orleans East, where she has been working for the last 10-15 years. She now occasionally works for the Audubon Nature Institute, the Restore the Earth Foundation, and the Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries. Her passion is wetlands education and restoration.

physicalDescription.extent: 1 digital audio file (34 minutes); Abstract (3 leaves); Index (8 leaves)
